Can we deduce the original function \\( z(t) \\) after observing its Fourier transform \\( \\hat{z}(\\omega) \\), specifically identifying the angular frequency \\( \\omega \\) used, without knowing the original function?

The properties of the Fourier transform allow for this precise deduction from effect back to cause.
